content: Jie Fu is a happy üòÑ machine learning postdoc with his human-friendly big AI dream. He is focusing on drug discovery (antibiotics discovery in particular) at Quebec Artificial Intelligence Institute (Mila), supervised by Yoshua Bengio and Chris Pal. He is also broadly interested in reinforcement learning and language processing.

content:
Discovery and development of antibiotics have significantly reduced the burdens of infectious disease in human population in the past. However, due to natural evolution of microbes and inappropriate usages of antibiotics in healthcare and agriculture, antibiotic resistance has become an urgent problem world wide. In addition, due to various reasons 1, development of new antibiotics, especially those with novel structures and targets, has slowed down in the past decades. In the near future, emergence of widely spread antibiotic resistant micro-organism will cause more problems in the developing world where antibiotics are more frequently prescribed.
Traditionally, antibiotics were mostly developed by screening secondary metabolites and their semi-synthetic derivatives of soil-dwelling microbes for inhibiting growth of pathogenic microorganism. However, due to increasing difficulties in identifying effective chemicals from the space among secondary metabolites, no new clinical antibiotics has been discovered using this method since 1980s. Therefore, novel methods for antibiotics discovery are urgently needed.
I’m leading an initiative for antibiotic discovery with an active learning framework. I will share more details in the near future.
  Most pharmaceutical companies have abandoned the development of new antibiotics and have instead focused on developing more profitable drugs for non-communicable diseases. ↩︎
title: Antibiotic Discovery

content: I’m working on drug-target interaction prediction projects, which can be used to screen potential drugs. I’m adapting tools from NLP community, e.g. language models. Wil share results soon.
summary: adapting tools from NLP (e.g. language models)
title: Drug-Target Interaction

content: I’m working on protein remote homology detection projects. I’m adapting tools from IR community. Wil share results soon.
title: Protein Remote Homology Detection

content:
Sample efficiency is key to the real-world application of RL. That is we wish to minimize the interactions between the RL and the environment.
Right now, I’m working on meta RL projects. Wil share results soon.
title: Meta RL

content:
I üëΩ am always passionate about talking / mentoring / working with junior self-motivated students üòπ. Here is a list of my current research interests:
 Drug Discovery: protein sequence modeling, antibiotics discovery, drug-target interaction Reinforcement Learning: meta RL, goal-conditioned, hierarchical RL, sample-efficient RL, navigation, emergent communication Language Processing: text generation  Drop me an email if you are interested to have a chat.
